events.title: Historic Date: September 20, 1943, Marks a Turning Point in Global Events
Submarine Maneuvers Intensify Following X-Craft Slip: September 20th Update
events.description: Movements of Submarines after Slipping X-craft. 20th September

events.title: September 20th: The Day That Changed Everything
Allied Forces Capture Tonzang: Japanese Retreat Leaves Trail of Defeat and Abandoned Equipment
events.description: 64. By the 20th September, we were attacking strong enemy positions about Tonzang, the first town of any size after leaving the Imphal Plain. By the 22nd, a double advance from the north and south made the Japanese evacuate this place without opposition, but severe punishment was inflicted on their retreating columns. Tonzang was full of enemy dead and much equipment was captured.

events.title: U-Boat Pack Strikes Back: Minesweeper LEDA and Merchant Ship Sunk Amidst Fierce Escort Defense
events.description: 52. No air attacks developed, but the U-boat pack, whose performance so far had been mediocre, made a final effort to redeem their failure. In spite of vigorous counter-attacks by the powerful escort, they succeeded in sinking the minesweeper LEDA (Commander A. H. Wynne-Edwards, R.N.) and one merchant ship on 20th September, and in hitting the
